He further added that the company is targeting a revenue of ₹470-500 crore this fiscal.

175.title: RBI forex measures to impact flow positively: Economic Affairs Secy
175.article_body: Economic Affairs Secretary Ajay Seth on Thursday said the measures announced by the RBI on Wednesday to enhance foreign exchange inflows will have a "positive" impact on flows. "In the overseas NDF (non-deliverable forwards) market, the rupee has appreciated," he stated. This comes after the rupee hit an all-time low of 79.37 against the US dollar on Tuesday.

176.title: 77% weekly increase in number of monkeypox cases: WHO
176.article_body: The World Health Organization on Thursday said there was a 77% weekly increase in the number of monkeypox cases worldwide, taking the total caseload to over 6,000 which includes three deaths. The increase in cases was reported mostly from Europe and Africa. The health agency said the disease is mainly found among men who have had sex with other men.

177.title: Stalin congratulates PT Usha, Ilaiyaraaja on Rajya Sabha nomination
177.article_body: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin has extended greetings to athlete PT Usha and music icon Ilaiyaraaja on their Rajya Sabha nomination. "Congratulations to PT Usha on being nominated to the Council of States," Stalin tweeted. Stalin also congratulated the music maestro for his upcoming stint in the Rajya Sabha. Ilaiyaraaja thanked Stalin for the wishes.

178.title: Terrorist linked Al-Badr arrested in Jammu & Kashmir's Awantipora
178.article_body: A terrorist linked to outfit Al-Badr was arrested in Jammu and Kashmir's Awantipora by the police. Upon getting information, J&K police along with the Army and CRPF officials established a joint checkpoint in the area. The terrorist, identified as Aamir Ahmed Parray, was arrested during the check. A pistol and four pistol rounds were recovered from his possession.

179.title: Jamia Millia's offline classes to start from July 16
179.article_body: Jamia Millia Islamia on Thursday said their offline classes will start from July 16, except for first semester/year students for whom classes will begin from August 1. The ongoing admission process will close on July 31. Examinations will be held from December 1 to 15 and the winter break will be from December 23 to January 1, 2023.

180.title: Climate tech startup Climes raises $1.2 mn from Sequoia, others
180.article_body: Climate tech startup Climes has raised $1.2 million in a funding round led by Sequoia Capital India, Kalaari Capital, Avaana Capital and Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath. Climes will use the raised capital to integrate with different brands and enable a pathway for companies to become climate leaders. It'll also upgrade its tech stack to enable quick adoption of climate solutions.

181.title: Nykaa parent shares surge 5% after men's innerwear brand launch
181.article_body: The shares of Nykaa's parent company, FSN E-Commerce Ventures, surged around 5% on Thursday. On BSE, its stock hit an intraday high of ₹1,469.85. This comes after the company announced the launch of its first innerwear and athleisure brand for men called GLOOT. Nykaa Fashion said GLOOT is a "highly intelligent" tech creation that will provide anti-stain and anti-odour products.

182.title: Ukrainian Prez expresses 'sadness' at Boris Johnson's resignation
182.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Thursday called Boris Johnson to express his "sadness" over the British leader's resignation as the PM of the UK. "Not only me, but...the entire Ukrainian society...is very sympathetic to you," he said. "We have no doubt that Great Britain's support will be preserved, but your personal leadership and charisma made it special," he added.

183.title: Map industrial activities for Gati Shakti scheme: FM to NITI Aayog
183.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Thursday asked the NITI Aayog to prepare a report mapping all industrial activities, including defence corridors and pharma hubs, so that they can be incorporated under the PM Gati Shakti scheme. "I find many of them still lying loose and unconnected," she stated, while adding, "Mapping it up will probably give a better idea."

184.title: SoftBank's Rajeev Misra steps down from main roles to launch own fund
184.article_body: Rajeev Misra is stepping back from his main roles at SoftBank Group to launch his own venture fund, reports said. Misra will retain his role overseeing the first $100 billion Vision Fund but will cede his frontline role in managing the second Vision Fund. He's reportedly secured over $6 billion in backing for his fund, including from Middle East investors.

185.title: Meta builds new AI model which can translate 200 languages
185.article_body: Meta, the parent company of Facebook and Instagram, announced that it has built a new AI model which can translate 200 different languages. The model, built under Meta's 'No Language Left Behind' project, aims to enable over 25 billion translations across the company's apps daily. This comes after Meta was accused of failing to moderate harmful content in some languages.

186.title: 24-yr-old biker dies after truck hits him in Thane
186.article_body: A 24-year-old biker was killed after a trailer truck hit him from behind in Bhiwandi, Thane, on Wednesday night. Police filed a case of death by negligence against the unidentified truck driver, who escaped the scene after the accident. The accused driver was allegedly speeding, an official said.

187.title: Rohit breaks Kohli's record, becomes fastest to reach 1,000 T20I runs as India captain
187.article_body: India skipper Rohit Sharma on Thursday broke ex-India captain Virat Kohli's record for being the fastest Indian batter to reach 1,000 runs in T20I cricket as captain. With his 24(14) against England in the first T20I, Rohit crossed 1,000 T20I runs in 29 innings as captain. Kohli had taken 30 T20I innings to reach the 1,000-run mark as captain.

188.title: India elected to UNESCO panel on Intangible Cultural Heritage
188.article_body: India has been elected to the Intergovernmental Committee of UNESCO's 2003 Convention for the Safeguarding of the Intangible Cultural Heritage (ICH) for the 2022-2026 cycle, Union Minister G Kishan Reddy announced on Thursday. As the nation celebrates Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav, India will be a part of two prominent Committees of UNESCO - ICH and World Heritage, he said.

189.title: KTR inaugurates Safran's electrical and power factory in Hyderabad
189.article_body: Telangana IT Minister KT Rama Rao inaugurated French aerospace major Safran's electrical and power factory in Hyderabad on Thursday. "For the first time the group has decided to venture...in India and we're glad that you found Hyderabad to be the best ecosystem for setting up your...factories," KTR said. Aircraft engine facility will be set up with a 36 million-euro investment.

190.title: Development isn't 'chamak-dhamak' but empowerment of poor: PM Modi
190.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday addressed a gathering in Varanasi, stating that development doesn't mean "chamak-damak" (glitter) but rather empowerment of the poor and deprived communities. He added that the government is working on providing piped water access to every household and building pucca houses. PM's remarks came after he laid foundation stones of projects worth ₹1,774 crore at event.

191.title: Spain's Pamplona hosts 1st bull-running festival since 2019
191.article_body: The first bull run since 2019 took place on Thursday at the San Fermín festival in Spain's Pamplona. Several runners were stomped, trampled or shoved to the cobblestone pavement during the run. "The energy is awesome - this is the greatest party, the greatest thing I've ever seen in my life," a tourist from Hawaii said.

192.title: My focus wasn't COVID-19: Alia on staying with Neetu after Rishi Kapoor's death
192.article_body: Alia Bhatt recalled staying with Neetu Kapoor after Rishi Kapoor's demise in 2020. She said, "I remember...April, May, June, my focus was not...on COVID...because we, as a family, were dealing with Rishi uncle's passing away...So, that was like...bang in the middle of the pandemic." "Post that it was spending time with Ranbir's mum...so that we could...be around her," she added.

193.title: 96% of Portugal is experiencing drought
193.article_body: Portugal is experiencing one of its worst drought spells, with 96% of the country declared to be under "extreme" or "severe" drought conditions. The temperatures in some parts of the country are expected to touch 43°C over this weekend. Government bodies have readied emergency teams as a third of the country is at risk of forest fires, officials said.

194.title: Actor-politician Raj Babbar gets 2-yr jail term for assaulting a polling officer in 1996
194.article_body: A Lucknow court has sentenced actor and Congress leader Raj Babbar to two years in jail for assaulting a polling officer in 1996 while contesting from Samajwadi Party. Babbar was convicted for voluntarily causing hurt to deter a public servant from performing his duty and three other offences. The court has also imposed a fine of ₹8,500 on him.

195.title: 10-month-old gets Railways' compassionate appointment after parents die
195.article_body: The Railways has given a compassionate appointment to a 10-month-old girl after her parents died in an accident in Chhattisgarh, officials said. She can work for Railways after turning 18 years of age. The girl's father, Rajendra Kumar, worked as an assistant at a railway yard in Bhilai. He, along with his wife, was killed in an accident in June.

196.title: Licences of country liquor suppliers extended in Delhi
196.article_body: Delhi government has extended the licences of country liquor suppliers by a month, as per an official notification. The licence-holders have been asked to pay pro-rata license fee for one month. While the Excise Policy of 2022-23 was approved by the Delhi government on May 5, it is yet to be approved by the Lieutenant Governor.

197.title: Police book man for stabbing food cart vendor in the neck in Guj
197.article_body: Police have booked a man who allegedly stabbed a food cart vendor multiple times in the neck for refusing to serve bread-omelette in Gujarat's Visnagar. As per the police, the accused Bhavik Patel approached food-cart vendor Nagjibhai Baldevbhai and attacked him when Nagjibhai said he ran out of bread. The Police have lodged a case under IPC section 307.

198.title: Sikhs, Hindus donate to family of Kabul gurdwara attack victim
198.article_body: Minority Afghan Sikhs and Hindus have donated 1 lakh afghani (around ₹90,000) to the relatives of the Muslim security guard who died in the terror attack on a gurdwara in Kabul last month. In the June 18 terror attack, two persons were shot dead. The Taliban government released 11 lakh afghani (₹9.72 lakh) for each of the deceased.

199.title: Federal Bank appoints MVS Murthy as its 1st Chief Marketing Officer
199.article_body: Federal Bank has appointed MVS Murthy as its first Chief Marketing Officer (CMO). Prior to being appointed at Federal Bank, Murthy was heading marketing, digital and corporate communication at TATA AMC. "We're happy to welcome MVS to the Federal family...I'm certain his vast experience will strengthen our brand positioning," said Federal Bank Chief Human Resources Officer (CHRO) Ajith Kumar KK.

200.title: Cong has been constantly attacking constitutional institutions: Rijiju
200.article_body: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju criticised Congress and said the party has been constantly attacking constitutional institutions from the beginning. "Don't forget that people of India are not servants of anyone," Rijiju tweeted. Rijiju's comment comes a day after Congress' Abhishek Singhvi accused the BJP of promoting personal attacks on Supreme Court judges.

201.title: BSF nabs 4 Pakistani fishermen from creek area in Gujarat's Kutch
201.article_body: A BSF patrol on Thursday caught four Pakistani fishermen and seized their 10 boats off the coast of Kutch in Gujarat along the India-Pakistan maritime border, a force spokesperson said. Nothing suspicious was recovered from the boats, the spokesperson said, adding that fishermen were trying to sneak "into Indian territory" through one of the water channels of 'Harami Nalla' creek.

202.title: Delhi reports 579 new COVID-19 cases and 1 death in last 24 hours
202.article_body: Delhi reported 579 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, the health department said on Thursday. The national capital also reported one COVID-19-related death, while 688 people recovered from the virus in the last 24 hours. Delhi's positivity rate now stands at 3.46% and there are currently 2,480 active coronavirus patients in the city.

203.title: Court sends 7 accused in Amravati chemist's killing to NIA custody
203.article_body: A special court in Mumbai on Thursday remanded seven persons arrested in connection with the killing of an Amravati-based chemist in the custody of National Investigation Agency (NIA) till July 15. Umesh Kolhe was stabbed to death after he shared a WhatsApp post supporting suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma. Kolhe was on his way home when he was attacked.

204.title: 18-yr-old medical aspirant kills self in TN after finding NEET too hard
204.article_body: An 18-year-old boy preparing for National Eligibility-cum-Entrance Test (NEET) allegedly died by suicide after finding the exam too hard. The boy, who completed Class 12 last year, failed the exam in his previous attempt. Police said they found a note in his room that stated that he tried his best but felt he wouldn't be able to score enough marks.

205.title: India's playing XI for first T20I against England announced
205.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to bat first against England in the first T20I at The Rose Bowl in Southampton. Rohit and Ishan Kishan will open the batting for India. India's playing XI also includes Deepak Hooda, Suryakumar Yadav and Hardik Pandya. Meanwhile, Arshdeep Singh is making his India debut today.

206.title: Curbing global warming can cut Indian fossil fuel revenues: Report
206.article_body: In its efforts to limit global warming to 1.5 °C, India's fossil fuel revenues can drop around 65% of the 2019 levels by 2050, a report by the International Institute for Sustainable Development (IISD) said. Revenues from coal production can fall 15%, it added. India's fossil fuel revenues were $92.9 billion in 2019, accounting for 18% of total government revenues.

207.title: Arshdeep becomes India's 99th T20I cricketer, pics from cap presentation ceremony surface
207.article_body: Fast bowler Arshdeep Singh has become the 99th cricketer to represent India in T20I cricket. The 23-year-old received his debut cap from captain Rohit Sharma, with pictures from the cap presentation ceremony surfacing online. Arshdeep has played 49 T20 matches so far, taking 52 wickets. He represents Punjab in domestic cricket and Punjab Kings in IPL.

208.title: IndiGo hikes pilot, crew salaries after reported mass leave on Air India hiring day
208.article_body: IndiGo has hiked the salaries of its pilots and cabin crew by a further 8%, days after reports said that the airline's staff took mass sick leave to attend Air India's recruitment drive. The airline will also reinstate layover and deadhead allowances for pilots and crew from July 31. Crew unavailability had caused delays for hundreds of IndiGo flights recently.

209.title: Pankaj to play Atal Bihari Vajpayee in former Prime Minister's biopic: Reports
209.article_body: Actor Pankaj Tripathi will reportedly play former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee in the film titled Main Rahoon Ya Na Rahoon, Yeh Desh Rehna Chahiye, Atal. It is an adaptation of Ullekh NP’s book The Untold Vajpayee: Politician and Paradox. Reportedly, the film on Atal Bihari Vajpayee will be produced by Vinod Bhanushali, Sandeep Singh, Kamlesh Bhanushali and Vishal Gurnani.

210.title: Centre releases ₹324 crore from SDRF for Assam flood relief aid
210.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Thursday thanked PM Narendra Modi for releasing ₹324.40 crore from State Disaster Response Fund (SDRF) in advance, stating that the amount would benefit the state. Over 170 people have died in the state due to torrential rains. Notably, Assam and Meghalaya recorded the highest June rainfall since 1966, IMD said.

211.title: Orange alert issued for Himachal, heavy rain likely in next 2 days
211.article_body: IMD has issued an orange weather alert for the next two days in Himachal Pradesh. "Heavy-very heavy rain with thunderstorm and lightning is likely to take place on Friday and Saturday...causing flash floods and triggering landslides," Shimla MeT centre Director Surender Paul said. Reportedly, 49 people died in rain-related mishaps in Himachal since the onset of monsoon on June 29.

212.title: My romance with Ranbir started due to a faulty plane seat: Alia Bhatt
212.article_body: In her appearance on Koffee With Karan season 7, Alia Bhatt revealed how the romance started between her and Ranbir due to a faulty plane seat. "[Ranbir]...was supposed to sit next to me...But...something got stuck on his seat," she added. "I was like, 'Why is this happening, why is my dream getting shattered?' But later...he came back," Alia said.

213.title: Tricolour to be hoisted at every house in Haryana from August 11-17
213.article_body: The Haryana government has launched a campaign to ensure that each house in Haryana should have the national flag hoisted from August 11-17. "This is a national festival and all the citizens of the country are fortunate that they are getting the auspicious opportunity to hoist the tricolour at their homes," said Chief Secretary Sanjeev Kaushal.

214.title: Didn’t ask for info on those giving beheading calls against Hindus: NIA
214.article_body: The NIA on Thursday denied having asked people to inform it about anyone giving 'beheading' calls against Hindus in connection with the controversial remarks made by suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma. "Such messages are totally fake and malicious and are part of a mischievous design to mislead the public," NIA said in a statement.

215.title: Our missile strike killed Ukrainian troops on Snake Island: Russia
215.article_body: Russian Defence Ministry has said that its warplane struck and killed an unspecified number of Ukrainian troops on Snake Island in the Black Sea on Thursday. The troops had landed there to raise Ukraine's flag. Ukraine said earlier that its military forced Russia to retreat from Snake Island, while Russia claims it pulled out from the territory as "goodwill gesture".

216.title: China's Xiaomi produces first smartphones in Vietnam
216.article_body: China's Xiaomi Corporation on Thursday said that it has produced its first batch of smartphones in Vietnam. The smartphones were produced in Thai Nguyen in a factory operated by Xiaomi's partner DBG Technology. The devices have been sent to a Vietnamese distributor, Xiaomi said, adding that it would soon export smartphones to other Southeast Asian markets, including Malaysia and Thailand.

217.title: Unhelpful: India as it responds to Germany's comments on Mohammed Zubair's arrest
217.article_body: The Centre reacted to Germany's remarks on Mohammed Zubair's arrest and said, "This is our internal matter...Any comment on it is unhelpful. It's not right." "Matter is before the court. Our legal system is independent," it added. "India describes itself as the world's largest democracy. So one can expect democratic values like freedom of expression," Germany Foreign Ministry had said.

218.title: Facebook asks US court for FTC merger papers amid antitrust lawsuit
218.article_body: Meta's Facebook has asked an American court for eight documents created by the US Federal Trade Commission (FTC) to review the company's purchases of Instagram and WhatsApp. This comes amid FTC's antitrust lawsuit against Facebook. Facebook claimed the documents would reveal that FTC had earlier determined that the acquisitions were unlikely to lessen competition or harm consumers.

219.title: Tender for 200 4th-generation Vande Bharat trains by Aug: Report
219.article_body: Indian Railways is in the final stages of readying a tender to manufacture the fourth-generation Vande Bharat trains, a senior official told Moneycontrol. They said, "The bidding documents for the fourth generation of 200 Vande Bharat trains have been finalised...We're planning to float the tender by August." India plans to manufacture 400 Vande Bharat trains in the next three years.

220.title: Nitin Gadkari awarded honorary degree of Doctor of Science in Maha
220.article_body: Union Minister for Road Transport and Highways Nitin Gadkari was conferred the honorary degree of Doctor of Science by Dr Panjabrao Deshmukh Krishi Vidyapeeth in Maharashtra's Akola. Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari awarded the degree to the Gadkari. Former Vice Chancellor Dr Motilal Madan, deans of faculty, professors, teachers and graduating students were present on the occasion.

221.title: Global economic outlook has darkened, can't rule out recession: IMF
221.article_body: IMF MD Kristalina Georgieva has said the outlook for the global economy has "darkened significantly" since April and the possibility of a global recession next year can't be ruled out. "We're in very choppy waters," she added, citing a more universal spread of inflation and increased interest rate hikes. IMF would soon further downgrade its 2022 growth forecast, she added.

222.title: Mumbai beaches to open only from 6-10 am during red, orange alerts for rainfall
222.article_body: Beaches in Mumbai will open for the general public only from 6 am to 10 am during the period of red and orange alerts issued by IMD, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) said. The decision has been taken in view of drowning incidents on various beaches in the city this year. People should be informed about it immediately, BMC added.

223.title: Dalai Lama is India's guest: MEA on reaction to PM's b'day greeting
223.article_body: After China criticised PM Narendra Modi for greeting Dalai Lama on his 87th birthday on Wednesday, the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) on Thursday said that India treats the Tibetan spiritual leader as an honoured guest. The Chinese Foreign Ministry had said that India should fully recognise the separatist nature of Dalai Lama and stop interfering in China's internal affairs.

224.title: Rajnath Singh to brief parliamentary panel on Agnipath scheme on July 11
224.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh will brief the members of the Parliamentary Consultative Committee on Defence on various aspects of the Agnipath scheme on July 11. The committee comprises MPs from ruling as well as opposition parties. The Defence Secretary, three Service Chiefs and other senior officials of the Defence Ministry are likely to be present in the meeting.

225.title: Katrina Kaif and Vicky Kaushal's romance began on 'Koffee With...': Karan
225.article_body: Karan Johar revealed it was on his show 'Koffee With Karan', where Vicky Kaushal and Katrina Kaif's romance began. In an interview with a news portal, Karan revealed that he "loved" that the "VicKat" romance started on his couch. "I love...Vicky, Katrina's romance. I love...it came out of nowhere, it was beautiful and it started on this couch," Karan said.

226.title: What is the 'Pennywise' malware that uses YouTube videos to steal crypto?
226.article_body: Cyber intelligence company Cyble has warned of an "emerging threat" from a crypto-stealing malware called 'Pennywise' which may potentially spread through YouTube. Fraudsters are reportedly marketing 'Pennywise' as a free Bitcoin mining software and it can target 30 crypto wallets and browser extensions. More than 80 YouTube videos have been found that may expose users to potential hacks.

227.title: Afghan soil won't be used for attacks on other countries: Taliban
227.article_body: Taliban leader Hibatullah Akhundzada said on Wednesday that no country will be allowed to use Afghan soil to target other countries. Akhundzada also added that other nations should refrain from meddling in Afghanistan's internal affairs. "We want...strong diplomatic, economic and political relations with the whole world, including the US, within the framework of mutual...commitment," he added.

228.title: TMC delegation meets Governor over Dilip Ghosh's remarks against Mamata
228.article_body: An eight-member delegation of TMC, including party's leader Kunal Ghosh, met Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar on Thursday, seeking action against BJP leader Dilip Ghosh for his alleged derogatory comments against West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee. Governor Dhankhar has assured the TMC delegation that he will look into the matter. Ghosh had allegedly made some remarks about Banerjee's family during an event.

229.title: 16-yr-old accused of killing 17-yr-old TN boy to be tried as adult
229.article_body: A 16-year-old boy, accused of killing a 17-year-old schoolmate in Tamil Nadu, will be tried as an adult after his case was transferred to regular criminal court. Selva Surya died on April 30 after three students of a government school in Tirunelveli district attacked him with a stone. Of the three accused, only one will be tried as an adult.

230.title: 9 minor boys escape from observation home in Chhattisgarh
230.article_body: Nine inmates of an observation home for minor boys, one of whom was facing murder charge, in Chhattisgarh's Dantewada escaped on Thursday, officials said. "All nine inmates tied the caretaker, a home guard jawan and another officer with ropes," an official said. In all, 19 minor inmates accused of various crimes were lodged at the remand home, the official added.

231.title: S Korean group floats balloons toward N Korea with COVID relief items
231.article_body: A South Korean group said that it launched 20 balloons carrying COVID-19 relief items toward North Korea on Wednesday. The balloons carried 20,000 masks and tens of thousands of vitamin C and fever-reducing tablets to the isolated country amid a COVID-19 outbreak there. This comes after North Korea suggested that the outbreak began due to balloons flown from South Korea.

232.title: Rajnath Singh calls up Tejashwi to enquire about Lalu Yadav's health
232.article_body: Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Thursday spoke to Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Tejashwi Yadav and enquired about health of RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav, who is admitted at AIIMS in Delhi. "Praying for his speedy recovery," Rajnath Singh tweeted. Lalu Prasad Yadav was airlifted from Patna after he suffered a fracture due to a fall.

233.title: Doing my best to help underpopulation crisis: Musk after reports of welcoming twins
233.article_body: After reports claimed that Elon Musk welcomed twins with Neuralink top executive Shivon Zilis in November 2021, the Tesla CEO tweeted, "Doing my best to help the underpopulation crisis." "A collapsing birth rate is the biggest danger civilization faces by far," he added. Musk shares two children with singer Grimes and other five kids with his ex-wife Justine Wilson.

234.title: Precautions taken: Bommai after IMD predicts heavy rains in K'taka
234.article_body: After IMD predicted heavy rains in parts of Karnataka, CM Basavaraj Bommai said all necessary precautions have been taken after speaking to district deputy commissioners. "As per IMD, heavy rain is predicted in Kodagu, Dakshina Kannada, Udupi and Uttara Kannada," he said, adding teams are prepared with equipment. Three people died after a landslide in Dakshina Kannada district on Wednesday.

235.title: Bhadohi MP Ramesh Chand Bind gets threat call, FIR registered
235.article_body: Police on Thursday said that BJP MP from Uttar Pradesh's Bhadohi, Ramesh Chand Bind, received an extortion call from an unidentified person who demanded ₹10 lakh from him. As per the complaint, the caller threatened to kill the MP and his family members if he failed to pay. An FIR has been lodged against the unidentified person, police said.

236.title: People think my decision to divorce Rajeev is wrong, it's for my daughter: Charu
236.article_body: Charu Asopa talked about her divorce from Rajeev Sen in her vlog and said people think her decision to divorce Rajeev is wrong, but she is taking the step after a lot of thinking. "I'm not taking the decision in a hurry or emotionally," she added. "I'm taking it consciously. It's not for me, it's for Ziana (daughter)," Charu said.

237.title: Russian forces taking operational pause in Ukraine: Foreign analysts
237.article_body: Russian forces may be taking an operational pause in Ukraine as part of efforts to reassemble its forces for a renewed assault, foreign analysts said. However, shelling by Russian forces in eastern Ukraine continued, according to Ukrainian officials. On Sunday, Russia said that it had taken control of Ukraine's Luhansk region after the fall of Lysychansk city.

238.title: India-focused PE, VC funds raised $14.1 bn in 2022: Report
238.article_body: In the first half of 2022, various India-focused private equity and venture capital funds have already raised $14.1 billion, as per a report by the Silicon Valley Bank. In the entirety of 2021, $4.2 billion was raised. As per the report, 48 funds have been launched in India taking the count from 28 last year to 76 now.

239.title: 16-yr-old accused of killing 17-yr-old TN boy to be tried as adult
239.article_body: A 16-year-old boy, accused of killing a 17-year-old schoolmate in Tamil Nadu, will be tried as an adult after his case was transferred to regular criminal court. Selva Surya died on April 30 after three students of a government school in Tirunelveli district attacked him with a stone. Of the three accused, only one will be tried as an adult.

240.title: School kids greet PM Modi with songs in UP's Varanasi, video surfaces
240.article_body: School children greeted Prime Minister Narendra Modi by singing songs in Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi on Thursday. A video shared by BJP MP Anurag Thakur shows the Prime Minister sitting with a group of students who perform one by one. A boy played a drum in front of PM Modi, who praised him saying 'Shabash'.

241.title: 3 TMC workers killed by unidentified attackers in West Bengal
241.article_body: Three Trinamool Congress (TMC) workers were killed by unidentified attackers in the South 24 Parganas district of West Bengal on Thursday morning, police said. The deceased TMC workers, identified as Swapan Manjhi, Bhootnath Pramanik and Jantu Haldar, were on a bike when the attackers shot at them. The initial investigation suggests it seems to be a case of political violence.

242.title: Vivo India sent 50% of its income to China to avoid paying taxes: ED
242.article_body: The Indian arm of Chinese smartphone maker Vivo remitted 50% of its turnover to China to avoid paying taxes here, the Enforcement Directorate (ED) said. Around ₹62,476 crore of Vivo India's income was remitted to disclose huge losses in Indian incorporated companies, the agency said. Funds worth ₹465 crore in 119 banks linked to Vivo India entities have been seized.

243.title: Form welfare board for autorickshaw, taxi drivers: Sena MLA to Shinde
243.article_body: Rebel Shiv Sena MLA Uday Samant on Thursday urged Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde to form a board for the welfare of autorickshaw and taxi drivers in the state on the lines of Tamil Nadu. In a letter to Shinde, Samant said the move will benefit 8.32 lakh licensed autorickshaw and 90,000 taxi drivers and owners.

244.title: Kapil's show in New York postponed; Promoter says it's due to scheduling conflict
244.article_body: Kapil Sharma's show in New York has been postponed. The local promoter of the show shared on its website that the gig has been postponed due to a "scheduling conflict". The date of Kapil's New York show hasn't been announced yet but for audiences who've already booked their tickets for July 9, their ticket stands valid for the next date.

245.title: Madras HC dismisses pleas against ex-CM Edappadi Palaniswami
245.article_body: The Madras High Court on Thursday dismissed contempt applications against former Chief Minister Edappadi K Palaniswami for allegedly disregarding its June 23 orders. The pleas were dismissed as the Supreme Court stayed the June 23 orders, which restrained the AIADMK from passing resolutions on its leadership. Palaniswami's supporters are pushing for him to be the party's top leader.

246.title: Setu gets in-principle RBI nod to operate as an account aggregator
246.article_body: Agya Technology, a subsidiary of Pine Labs-owned fintech platform Setu, has received in-principle approval from the Reserve Bank of India to operate as an account aggregator (AA). The approval came on July 4. This will allow Setu to launch its own AA platform. AAs are non-banking financial companies that enable sharing and access to data between financial institutions.

247.title: Over 6 million Sri Lankans facing food insecurity amid inflation: UN
247.article_body: The UN World Food Programme (WFP) has said that over six million Sri Lankans are facing food insecurity due to rising inflation amid the country's ongoing economic crisis. Some 61% of households in the country are using coping strategies, such as cutting down their food expenses, WFP's assessment noted. Sri Lanka currently has an inflation rate of over 50%.

248.title: BJP chose Murmu as Prez candidate to gain tribal votes: Medha Patkar
248.article_body: Social activist Medha Patkar claimed that the BJP has fielded Droupadi Murmu as NDA's Presidential candidate only because tribal community forms a major part of the vote bank. "They cannot claim to be pro-Adivasi by not granting them forest rights and planning to hand over forests to the corporates," she said. The Presidential election will be held on July 18.

249.title: Goa's flood monitoring system hacked; hackers seek ransom in crypto
249.article_body: Goa's flood monitoring system was hacked by ransomware attackers who have demanded payment in cryptocurrency to release data, according to a police complaint filed by the state's water resources department. "The attack was carried out on June 21, 2022 midnight between 12am-2am. The integrity of the data has been altered making it impossible to back up...previous data," the complaint stated.

250.title: Who is Shivon Zilis, the executive with whom Elon Musk reportedly welcomed twins?
250.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk welcomed twins with Shivon Zilis, a top executive at his brain-chip startup Neuralink, in November 2021, reports said. The 36-year-old, who grew up in Canada and attended Yale University, has worked as a Project-Director at Tesla. She's a founding member of the investment team at Bloomberg Beta and also featured in Forbes' 30 under 30 list.

251.title: Central Vista Avenue redevelopment project to be completed by July 18
251.article_body: Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Thursday said the redevelopment project of Central Vista Avenue from Vijay Chowk to India Gate, will be completed by July 18. He said some minor works are currently being carried out at one or two underpasses. Earlier, he said that Delhiites would be pleasantly surprised to see how the area is being totally transformed.

252.title: Haven't decided yet: TMC on taking disciplinary action against Moitra
252.article_body: TMC MP Saugata Roy on Thursday said the party hasn't taken any decision regarding taking disciplinary action against the party's MP Mahua Moitra over her remarks on Goddess Kali. "[TMC]...will make a decision at an appropriate time," he said, adding, "We don't approve of such comments." Notably, Moitra had said, "For me, Goddess Kali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting goddess."

253.title: 3 Pune health officers caught for taking bribe from sonography centre
253.article_body: Maharashtra ACB has arrested three health department officers from Pune, including the district civil surgeon, for allegedly demanding a bribe for issuing a licence renewal certificate to a private sonography centre. According to the statement issued by ACB's DSP Shrihari Patil, the officers at the civil hospital in Aundh allegedly demanded ₹40,000 for issuing the renewal certificate.

254.title: Kashi best example of 'Sabka Sath, Sabka Vikas': PM Modi
254.article_body: After laying foundation stone for projects worth around ₹1,800 crore in his Lok Sabha constituency Varanasi, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said Kashi is the best example of 'Sabka Sath, Sabka Vikas'. "For us, development means poor, underprivileged, backward, tribals, women and old people feel empowered...we're ensuring work to get each poor a pucca house," PM Modi said.

255.title: 24-yr-old biker dies after speeding trailer rams into him in Thane
255.article_body: A 24-year-old biker died after a trailer mowed him down in Bhiwandi on Wednesday. "The deceased has been identified as Rahman Asrar Shah...He was going...towards Thane for personal work when the trailer came from behind and rammed into him...The driver who fled the spot was...speeding," police said. The victim, who was taken to a hospital, was declared dead before arrival.

256.title: Retd Kerala teacher builds temple that worships Indian Constitution
256.article_body: A Kerala-based 71-year-old retired social science teacher, Sivadasan Pillai, has built a temple where the main deity is Indian Constitution. "For me, my lord is Constitution and I worship it," Pillai said. The temple carries photos of Mahatma Gandhi, Swami Vivekananda, BR Ambedkar and Nobel Laureate Malala Yousafzai. The Preamble of the Constitution is etched on the temple's wall.

257.title: Producer Sandeep Singh threatened with 'Moosewala-like' death on FB, case filed
257.article_body: Film producer Sandeep Singh allegedly received a death threat on his Facebook account and filed a complaint at a local police station in Mumbai, police said. A case has been filed against an unknown person for threatening Singh with a death similar to singer Sidhu Moosewala, who was shot dead in May. Actor Salman Khan was earlier similarly threatened.

258.title: Go and sit on a beach: Michael Vaughan while suggesting 3-month break to Virat Kohli
258.article_body: Former England captain Michael Vaughan has said that Team India batter Virat Kohli needs a sabbatical. "Kohli looks like he needs three months away from cricket. Go and sit on a beach," Vaughan added. He further stated, "To have a three months break, is it going to affect him? No. Will it help him? Yes."

259.title: Tell your mate he isn't a thug: Tino to reporter over English media's treatment of Kohli
259.article_body: Ex-West Indies pacer Tino Best took to Twitter to defend Virat Kohli over English media criticising his aggression during Edgbaston Test. Reacting to a reporter's tweet over Kohli's celebration of Alex Lees' wicket, Best said, "Anyone who's bold, brown or black, y'all always got a damn problem with." He added, "Tell your mate...Virat isn't a thug...He's a modern day Icon...Simple."

260.title: Congrats on your first film as producer: Anushka to Alia for Darlings' teaser
260.article_body: Anushka Sharma congratulated Alia Bhatt on her film Darlings' teaser. "This looks lit," she wrote on Instagram. Besides, Anushka also sent wishes to Alia for donning the hat of a producer for the first time. "Congratulations, Alia...on your first film as...producer," she added. To this, Alia replied, "Thank you, my dearest Anushkaaa." Darlings is set to release on August 5.

261.title: 2 people given beheading threats in Rajasthan, police start probe
261.article_body: At least two men in Rajasthan's Bharatpur have allegedly received beheading threats by unknown persons in past 10 days, police said. An ambulance driver on Wednesday was approached by two unknown persons and handed over the threatening note, which was addressed to persons named Satish and Pramod, police said. This comes after a tailor was beheaded in Udaipur last month.

262.title: Man gets 5-year jail term for sexually assaulting minor girl in Hyd
262.article_body: A court in Hyderabad on Thursday sentenced a man to five years in jail for sexually assaulting a minor girl in February 2017. The victim was returning to her home from school when the accused stopped her. The man had previously also attempted to molest the girl under Kanchanbagh police station limits.

263.title: Chhattisgarh announces bagless day on Saturdays; kids to play sports
263.article_body: The Chhattisgarh government has announced bagless day in schools on Saturdays. The schools will organise yoga, sports and cultural activities on this day. An official said that the step has been introduced by the Department of School Education to make school education interesting and school principals will be asked to plan the activities for each Saturday of the month.

264.title: Jhunjhunwala-backed Akasa Air gets DGCA license to start commercial operations
264.article_body: Billionaire Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed Akasa Air has received its Air Operator Certificate (AOC) from the DGCA, the aviation regulator said on Thursday. The airline will reportedly begin commercial flight operations later this month. Announcing the AOC's receipt, the airline said, "This is a significant milestone, enabling us to open our flights for sale."

265.title: PM launches, lays foundation stone of ₹1800-crore projects in Varanasi
265.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday inaugurated and laid the foundation stone of multiple development projects worth over ₹1800 crore in UP's Varanasi. These projects include those relating to urban development, re-development of Namo Ghat, the heritage of Kashi, etc. During an event in Varanasi, PM Modi said, "Projects being launched in Varanasi will give momentum to the city's development journey."

266.title: India reacts to UK PM's resignation, says 'PM Modi & Johnson enjoyed close friendship'
266.article_body: After Boris Johnson resigned as the Prime Minister of the UK, India's External Affairs Ministry spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said, "PM Narendra Modi and PM Johnson enjoyed a close friendship." "These are internal developments, we are keeping a close watch...We have a multi-faceted partnership with the UK and we hope this will continue. We won't comment on leadership change," he added.

267.title: Uddhav still Sena chief, rebel group doesn't have recognition: MP
267.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Arvind Sawant on Thursday asserted that Uddhav Thackeray continues to be the Sena chief and stated that the rebel group doesn't have any recognition. "Even if two-thirds of the MLAs go, Uddhav Thackeray remains the Sena chief and according to law, only he is the one who can appoint a leader of the legislature party," he said.

268.title: JNU not against dhabas, but they've to follow rules & pay bills: VC
268.article_body: JNU Vice-Chancellor Santishree Dhulipudi Pandit said that the administration was not against the dhabas or canteens being there, but they have to follow the rules and pay their bills. "We are only trying to legalise. We are trying to say you pay the rent and electricity bill. They don't want to pay anything. They want everything free," she said.

269.title: Killings of 2 men from Manipur in Myanmar trigger protests
269.article_body: Protests erupted in Manipur's Moreh on Wednesday over the killing of two Tamil men from the state in a border town in Myanmar. The protesters also crossed the international border and torched a sentry post of Myanmar army. The bodies of P Mohan and M Iyarnar, who were shot dead, were found in Tamu on Tuesday.

270.title: Tata Projects, Power Grid executives arrested for bribery; ₹93 lakh cash seized
270.article_body: Senior executives of Power Grid Corporation of India and Tata Projects are among seven people arrested by CBI for alleged bribery to favour the private firm. Power Grid Executive Director BS Jha, Tata Projects Executive VP Deshraj Pathak and Assistant VP RN Singh have been arrested. Officials also recovered ₹93 lakh cash during a raid on Jha's Gurugram premises.

271.title: AAP shares pics from Bhagwant Mann and Gurpreet Kaur's wedding
271.article_body: AAP shared pictures from Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann and Dr Gurpreet Kaur's wedding on Thursday and wrote, "Punjab CM [Bhagwant Mann] & Dr. Gurpreet Kaur begin their married life. May God bless the Mann family with all the happiness in the world." Pictures showed the couple with Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and his family. Raghav Chadha also attending the wedding.

272.title: 3 tribals killed, 3 injured after being struck by lightning in MP
272.article_body: Three tribals were killed and three others suffered severe burn injuries after being struck by lightning in forest area in Madhya Pradesh's Sheopur, a police official said on Thursday. The victims identified as 28-year-old Rambharat Adivasi, 27-year-old Dilip Adivasi and 20-year-old Mukesh Adivasi went for a picnic in the Ajnoi forest area when the lightning struck them, police added.

273.title: Mumbai woman cheated of ₹3.7 lakh while selling furniture for ₹21,000
273.article_body: A 26-year-old Mumbai woman trying to sell furniture worth ₹21,000 online ended up losing ₹3.77 lakh to cyber fraud. According to the complainant, her company's manager asked her to collect the money from selling furniture for ₹21,000 on an online marketplace. The buyer, who turned out to be a cyber-fraudster, sent a QR code and made transactions worth ₹3.77 lakh.

274.title: TV set, desktop monitor stolen from Zilla Parishad school in Navi Mumbai
274.article_body: A television set and a desktop monitor were stolen from a Zilla Parishad school in Navi Mumbai's Taloja Panchanand area last week, police said. The thieves committed the crime after cutting the grill of the school building when no one was present there. The school authorities have registered a complaint at the Taloja police station.

275.title: B'luru Traffic Police announce deviations to ease traffic in Hebbal
275.article_body: The Bengaluru Traffic Police have come out with a fresh set of rules to decongest traffic on the Hebbal flyover and have blocked two crossover points in front of Manipal Hospital and Esteem Mall signal. "These changes have been proposed after studying the flow of vehicles at this junction, checking...data and factors causing traffic congestions," Bengaluru Traffic Police tweeted.

276.title: Ukraine to summon Turkish envoy after Russian ship with 'stolen grain' leaves
276.article_body: Ukraine has said that it will summon Turkey's ambassador to seek clarification after a Russian-flagged cargo ship allegedly carrying 'stolen' Ukrainian grain left a Turkish port. It is "unacceptable" that the Russian ship Zhibek Zholy was allowed to leave Karasu port despite "criminal evidence presented to the Turkish authorities", Ukrainian Foreign Ministry spokesperson Oleg Nikolenko said.

277.title: Very proud of my govt's achievements: Boris as he resigns as UK PM
277.article_body: Boris Johnson, who on Thursday resigned as UK's PM, said he's "immensely proud" of his government's achievements, adding that he'll remain caretaker PM until new leader is chosen. "To...millions of people who voted for us in 2019...Thank you for that incredible mandate," he added. Johnson quit after over 50 MPs of his party resigned in protest against his leadership.

278.title: NITI Aayog ex-CEO Kant to replace Piyush Goyal as G20 Sherpa: Reports
278.article_body: Former NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant will replace Union Minister Piyush Goyal as the Sherpa for the G20 Summit, reports said. Goyal reportedly requested Kant to take up the role because of his busy schedule. With G20 Presidency coming to India in December, a full-time Sherpa will reportedly be needed to devote a lot of time to meetings across India.

279.title: Aim behind NEP is to integrate education with modern ideas: PM Modi
279.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday inaugurated the three-day Akhil Bharatiya Shiksha Samagam in Varanasi. During the event, he said, "The foundational aim behind the National Education Policy is to bring education out from the limits of narrow thought-process and to integrate it with the modern ideas of...21st century." "NEP is paving the way for education in regional languages," he added.

280.title: Pune's SSPU invites startups to apply for ₹1-5 lakh funding, guidance
280.article_body: Savitribai Phule Pune University's (SSPU) Centre for Innovation, Incubation and Linkages is inviting early-stage startups to provide guidance and funding between ₹1 lakh to ₹5 lakh. Through its new pre-incubation platform, 'Power 2022,' the first five selected startups will be provided with the funds. The money will be given from the funds received from the Maharashtra State Innovation Society.

281.title: What are 'Nairobi flies', the skin-burning insects infecting students in Sikkim?
281.article_body: Over a hundred students of a Sikkim engineering college recently suffered severe skin infections due to 'Nairobi flies'. The small, beetle-like insects, which are orange and black in colour, thrive in areas with high rainfall. Health officials said these flies don't bite, but if disturbed while sitting on anyone's skin, they release potent acidic substance 'pederin' that causes burns.

282.title: Apologise to Delhi people for calling them thieves: AAP to LG
282.article_body: AAP on Thursday accused Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena of calling Delhi people "thieves" and demanded an apology for asking people to pay taxes to the civic body "honestly". "By the grace of God, you (LG) are sitting in a very responsible position. Delhi people only want cleanliness. There is no problem in paying taxes," said AAP's Durgesh Pathak.

283.title: 2-month-old crocodile rescued from a well in Thane
283.article_body: A baby crocodile, around two months old, was rescued from a well in Thane's Wagle Estate on Wednesday. It was rescued by Wildlife Welfare Association (WWA) and handed over to the forest department. "Well is not a natural habitat of crocodiles...someone might have brought it from a different place and thrown it in," an official of Thane forest department said.

284.title: I like to be a part of original stories: Ranbir on working in Shamshera
284.article_body: Speaking about working in Shamshera, Ranbir Kapoor said he likes to be a part of original stories and loves to have original music in his films. "Remixes...have their own place in the world and...audiences enjoy it. But, I like to be part of...original music," he added. "A lot of my success...has come through the music of my films," Ranbir said.

285.title: Man kills friend for not returning phone post call, held in Delhi
285.article_body: The Delhi Police have arrested a Nepali man for allegedly killing his friend for refusing to return his phone after making a call. According to DCP (central district) Shweta Chauhan, the accused killed the deceased after he refused to return his phone after making a phone call. The deceased also slapped the accused and called him a thief, Chauhan said.

286.title: 2 drug peddlers held in B'luru, 12 grams of MDMA crystals seized
286.article_body: Bengaluru City Police's Central Crime Branch (CCB) has arrested two drug peddlers from Sanjay Nagar, the city's Joint Commissioner of Police (Crime), Raman Gupta, said on Thursday. Police seized 12 grams of MDMA crystals, 27 grams of manufactured drug brown sugar and two mobile phones worth ₹3 lakh from the accused.

287.title: Finland passes law on more security on Russian border amid NATO bid
287.article_body: The Finnish parliament on Thursday voted to approve legislation that would allow barriers along the country's 1300-km long border with Russia. The legislation would also enable the closure of the border for refugees in case of exceptional circumstances. This comes days after NATO member countries officially signed off on the accession protocols for Finland and Sweden's induction into the bloc.

288.title: Iran detains several foreigners, a UK diplomat for spying
288.article_body: Iran's Revolutionary Guards have detained several foreigners, including Britain's second most senior envoy in Tehran, for alleged acts of spying. "These spies were taking earth samples in Iran's central desert where the Revolutionary Guards' aerospace missile exercises were conducted," state TV stated. "Reports of the arrest of a British diplomat in Iran are...false," UK's foreign office said.

289.title: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson resigns
289.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson has resigned after over 50 Members of Parliament resigned in protest at his leadership. This comes after UK's new Finance Minister asked Johnson to "go now", saying that the situation was "not sustainable and will only get worse". Johnson's supporters - including Priti Patel and Grant Shapps - had also urged him to step down.

290.title: 2 Punjab Police officers arrested for extorting money, possessing heroin
290.article_body: The Special Task Force (STF) of the Punjab Police arrested two police constables with 5 grams of heroin and seized ₹19,000 cash from them. The duo allegedly extorted money from a person, who possessed the contraband, in order to let him go. One of the accused is presently posted as  gunman with singer Mankirt Aulakh, STF officials said.

291.title: Rwanda, DR Congo agree to reduce tensions over rebel offensive
291.article_body: The Democratic Republic of the Congo and Rwanda have agreed to de-escalate tensions sparked due to an offensive by M23 rebels in DRC's eastern borderlands, the Congolese presidency announced on Wednesday after a summit in Angola. The agreement included an immediate cessation of hostilities and the retreat of M23 fighters, it added. The DRC has accused Rwanda of backing M23.

292.title: ICMR-VCRC creates special female mosquitoes to control dengue, chikungunya
292.article_body: ICMR-Vector Control Research Centre (VCRC) has developed special female mosquitoes to control dengue and chikungunya. Female mosquitoes will mate with males and produce larvae that do not carry these viruses. Two colonies of Aedes aegypti, infected with wMel and wAlbB Wolbachia strains called Ae aegypti (Pud), have been developed to decrease spread of the diseases.

293.title: Home Minister Amit Shah virtually unveils 'Statue of Peace' in Srinagar
293.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah virtually unveiled the 'Statue of Peace' of Swamy Ramanujacharya located in a temple in the Sonwar region of Srinagar on Thursday. "This will be a message of peace in not only Kashmir but the whole country," Shah said. Saint Ramanujacharya, also known as Ramanuja, is revered as a Vedic philosopher and social reformer.

294.title: Eijaz Khan hospitalised due to typhoid & fever, shares glimpse from hospital
294.article_body: Actor Eijaz Khan has recently been hospitalised due to typhoid and fever. Taking to Instagram Story, he shared a picture of his hand. In the picture, Eijaz is seen resting on the hospital bed and several syringes have been attached to his hand.  Sharing the photo, he mentioned in scientific terms that he has been diagnosed with Typhoid and fever.

295.title: Harry Maguire 'likes' Instagram post about Ronaldo being upset at Man Utd
295.article_body: Manchester United captain Harry Maguire reportedly liked an Instagram post that claimed Cristiano Ronaldo was unhappy at the club due to the recent salary cut. Maguire has since unliked the post and has said he clicked the button in error. Earlier, it was reported that Ronaldo has told Manchester United that he wants to leave the club.

296.title: We make mistakes, can be rectified: Mamata after Mahua faces FIR over her remark
296.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday said, "We make mistakes while working but they can be rectified." Her statement comes at a time when TMC's Mahua Moitra is facing FIRs over her remarks on Goddess Kali. "Some people don't see all the good work and suddenly start shouting...Negativity affects our brain cells so let's think positively," she added.

297.title: 53-yr-old Tripura woman clears board exams with daughters, says 'I'm happy'
297.article_body: A 53-year-old woman, Shila Rani Das, from Tripura has passed her 10th board exams at the same time when her daughters have cleared their 12th board exams. "I am happy that I've passed the exam. My daughters and other people supported me and inspired me to do it. I was confident that I will clear the exam," Das said.

298.title: Mismanagement caused DDA's liabilities to exceed ₹10,000 cr: Delhi LG
298.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena on Thursday said the Delhi Development Authority (DDA) owns one of the costliest chunks of real estate in the world, however, "mismanagement has led to its liabilities exceeding ₹10,000 crore". The LG tweeted a poster giving details of the financial condition of the urban body. He further invited suggestions to make the authority more "viable".

299.title: Only 3 states in India have at least one camera in each police station: Report
299.article_body: The India Justice Report, which analyses the police workforce in India, found that despite Supreme Court's order mandating CCTV cameras in all police stations, one in every three police stations does not have even a single camera. Odisha, Telangana and Puducherry were the only exceptions where all their police stations are equipped with at least one camera, the report said.

300.title: 'Kaali' director receives violent threats, says 'I don't feel safe anywhere'
300.article_body: 'Kaali' director Leena Manimekalai has alleged that she, her family and her collaborators have received thousands of threats of violence over her film's poster. "I do not feel safe anywhere at this moment," said Manimekalai. The alleged threats were sent from more than 200,000 accounts online, she said, calling it a "grand-scale mass lynching" by right-wing groups.

301.title: Canadian swimmer Harvey reveals she was drugged on last night of World C'ships
301.article_body: Canada's 22-year-old swimmer Mary-Sophie Harvey, who won bronze medal at the recently-concluded swimming World Championships in Budapest, revealed that she was drugged on the last night of the tournament. "There's this four-to-six-hour window where I can't recall a single thing," she wrote. Sharing pictures, she further revealed that she found a dozen of bruises on her body.

302.title: Was slapped by Rekha in 'Lajja', couldn't stop crying: Aarti Chabria
302.article_body: Actress Aarti Chabria said she couldn't stop crying after being slapped by actress Rekha in the film 'Lajja'. "I was [also] beaten up during [the film]," added Aarti. Discussing a scene from 'Awara Paagal Deewana' where she slaps Akshay Kumar's character, Aarti stated, "It was...an act...After I slap him, he immediately...raises his hand. That wasn't a part of the script."

303.title: Eknath Shinde officially takes charge as Maharashtra CM
303.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde formally took charge of his post at the state secretariat Mantralaya in Mumbai on Thursday. A 'puja' was held at the office of the CM before Shinde took charge. On Monday, the Shinde-led state government proved its majority in the Assembly as it surpassed the majority mark of 144.

304.title: Pune woman asked to pay electricity bill online, cheated of ₹10 lakh
304.article_body: A 53-year-old Pune-based woman allegedly lost over ₹10 lakh after a fraudster posing as a power company official asked her to pay her electricity bill online to avoid a power cut. The accused made the victim install 'Quick Support' and 'Any Desk' apps. She lost the money after she downloaded the apps and shared her phone screen with the accused.

305.title: Man rapes woman in Mumbai's hotel, threatens to leak private pics
305.article_body: A 38-year-old developer from Virar allegedly raped a 29-year-old woman in a five-star hotel in Mumbai, police said. The victim claimed the accused, who's her sister-in-law's husband, had promised to marry her and had also shot her private pictures and videos. She further alleged that he forced her to terminate her pregnancy and threatened to make her private pictures public.

306.title: Uterus transplants allow successful pregnancies in US women: Study
306.article_body: As many as 19 (58%) out of 33 women who underwent a uterus transplant in the US between 2016 and 2021 have delivered a total of 21 babies, researchers said. All the babies were delivered by Cesarean section, 14 months after the transplant on average. More than half of these babies were born after 36 weeks of gestation.

307.title: PM inaugurates 'Akshaya Patra' mid-day meal kitchen in Varanasi
307.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, on Thursday, inaugurated the 'Akshaya Patra' mid-day meal kitchen at the LT College in Varanasi, which can feed as many as 1 lakh students. As part of his visit, PM Modi will launch and lay the foundation stone for development projects worth ₹1,774 crore focused on improving infrastructure and ease of living, officials said.

308.title: Root is capable of breaking Sachin's Test tally record: Wasim Jaffer
308.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer has said England batter Joe Root can break Sachin Tendulkar's record of 15,921 runs in Test cricket. "Root can do it if he plays that long. He's only 31 years old...if he plays another five-six years...[then] he's capable of breaking the record," stated Jaffer. So far, Root has scored 10,458 runs in 121 Tests.

309.title: KCR didn't deliver promises, insulted PM with arrogance: BJP leader
309.article_body: BJP leader Gudur Narayana Reddy on Wednesday said that Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao failed in delivering promises and also accused him of insulting PM Narendra Modi with sheer arrogance. Reddy said that KCR has shown utter disrespect by not receiving PM Modi at the airport and for not taking part in the programmes being attended by the PM.

310.title: B2B marketplace Zetwerk promotes Ankit Fatehpuria as 5th Co-founder
310.article_body: B2B marketplace Zetwerk has promoted Ankit Fatehpuria, who joined the startup in 2019, as the fifth Co-founder of Zetwerk. Fatehpuria established the finance function of the company and also scaled multiple business verticals for it. Founded in 2018, Zetwerk acquired the unicorn status last year after raising $150 million in its Series E round at $1.33 billion valuation.

311.title: 19-year-old woman flung in air after being hit by a car in Hyd; video surfaces
311.article_body: A 19-year-old woman was critically injured after being hit by a car in Hyderabad's Rajendranagar. In a CCTV camera video of the incident, the woman is seen walking on the side of the road when a speeding car suddenly turned towards her and hit her. The woman was flung into the air before she fell down a few metre away.

312.title: Nakuul's mom says she doesn't like his hair in 'Bade...', actor shares chat
312.article_body: Television actor Nakuul Mehta took to Instagram to share a screenshot of his chat with his mother. In the chat, his mother told him that she does not like his hair in the television serial 'Bade Achhe Lagte Hain 2'. She asked why can't he go back to his original haircut. Mehta wrote he shared chat without his mother's consent.

313.title: Bengaluru residential unit sales jump 34% YoY in 1st quarter of 2022: Report
313.article_body: The Bengaluru residential real estate market saw its sales jump by 34% year-on-year (YoY) in the first quarter of 2022, according to global consultants Knight Frank's report. The residential real estate prices in Bengaluru also increased 7% YoY during this period, which is the highest in India. The rental levels increased by 4% in the city, as per the report.

314.title: Delhi Police arrests 2 men with demonetised currency worth ₹62 lakh
314.article_body: Delhi Police on Thursday said that they have arrested two men with demonetised currency worth ₹62 lakh. One of the accused informed the police that he purchased the demonetised currency from different people after paying ₹14 lakh in the new currency. The accused said that he had planned on selling the demonetised currency for ₹20 lakh.

315.title: DTC driver shot dead by bike-borne men in front of family in Delhi
315.article_body: A 45-year-old man was shot dead by two unidentified bike-borne men in front of his family in Delhi's Govindpuri, police said on Thursday. Around 8 pm on Wednesday, the deceased, along with his wife and eight-year-old son, were returning from a market when the two men opened fire at him, a senior police officer said.

316.title: Facebook accessed deleted Messenger app data of users: Fired employee
316.article_body: A fired Facebook employee has said a new protocol allowed members of the social network's Global Escalation Team "to circumvent Facebook's normal privacy protocols" by retrieving data from Messenger app "that users had chosen to delete". Brennan Lawson said he was fired for raising alarms about the protocol. Lawson has sued Facebook's parent Meta and is seeking over $3 million.

317.title: Sensex jumps 427 points to close at 54,178; Nifty ends above 16,000-mark
317.article_body: Indices rallied on Thursday with the BSE Sensex climbing 427 points (0.8%) to close over the 54,000-mark at 54,178 and the NSE Nifty50 closing above the 16,000-mark. Nifty50 rose 143 points or 0.89% and closed at 16,133. Titan Company, Tata Steel, L&T, ICICI Bank, IndusInd Bank, Kotak Bank and M&M were among the top gainers on Thursday.

318.title: Thanks for being my biggest supporter: Raina to Dhoni on his 41st b'day
318.article_body: Ex-India batter Suresh Raina took to Twitter to wish MS Dhoni on his 41st birthday, terming him as his "biggest" supporter and mentor in "every phase of life". "Happy Birthday to my big brother...May God bless you and your family with good health always. Much love to you Mahi bhai. Wishing you a great year ahead!" added Raina.

319.title: COVID vaccination mandatory to enter some public spaces in Beijing
319.article_body: People will have to show proof of COVID-19 vaccination before entering some public places, including gyms, cinemas, museums and libraries, in the Chinese capital Beijing from Monday. The list of public places requiring vaccination does not include restaurants and offices. Over 23 million people in Beijing have been vaccinated, a spokesperson for Beijing's Municipal Health Commission said.

320.title: Class 12 girl stabbed by neighbour after an argument in Delhi
320.article_body: A Class 12 girl was allegedly stabbed in the chest and stomach by her neighbour, a 17-year-old boy, after an argument broke out between them in West Delhi's Tilak Vihar area on Thursday. DCP (West) Ghanshyam Bansal said, "The victim and the accused...were friends for the past two-three years." Meanwhile, police have launched a manhunt to arrest the accused.

321.title: BJP demands ban on PFI after police arrest 4 party activists in T'gana
321.article_body: BJP's Telangana unit has urged the Union Home Ministry to ban the Popular Front of India (PFI) after four party activists were arrested in Nizamabad. "The PFI agenda confessed by...arrested suspects...is extremely unsettling and dangerous to the religious harmony...of this nation," said BJP's chief spokesperson K Krishna Sagar Rao, while calling it a "serious plot to destabilise the society''.

322.title: Delhi Police moves HC against Ishrat Jahan's bail in 2020 riots case
322.article_body: Delhi Police moved the Delhi High Court challenging the bail granted to former Congress councillor Ishrat Jahan in the larger conspiracy case of the 2020 Delhi riots. The trial court, which granted bail to Jahan, ignored the statements of protected witnesses, which "attributed a definite role" to her "not only in conspiracy but also in terror financing", Delhi Police stated.

323.title: Man returning home on bike with family from market shot dead in Delhi
323.article_body: A man returning home after purchasing food from a market with his wife and eight-year-old son was shot dead by two unknown assailants on Wednesday in southeast Delhi, police said. The family was near Deepalaya School when two persons fired at him near his right shoulder, police added. The man was rushed to a hospital where he was declared dead.

324.title: US exported 5 mn barrels of reserve oil to Asia, Europe last month amid record prices: Report
324.article_body: More than 5 million barrels of oil from the US Strategic Petroleum Reserve (SPR) were exported to Asia and Europe last month, as per reports. This comes despite the gasoline and diesel prices hitting record highs in the US. The latest exports follow three vessels that carried SPR crude to Europe in April helping replace Russian crude supplies.

325.title: He is a brilliant co-actor: Sanya Malhotra on working with Rajkummar Rao
325.article_body: Speaking about working with actor Rajkummar Rao in 'HIT: The First Case', actress Sanya Malhotra said, "When you're working with actors like Rajkummar Rao, it becomes more collaborative. You just have to follow their lead and react to what they're doing...So, I never felt anything was...challenging." She added that he's not only a good actor but a brilliant co-actor too.

326.title: B'luru reported over 5,000 COVID-19 cases in first 6 days of July
326.article_body: Bengaluru reported more than 5,000 COVID-19 cases in the first six days of July, i.e. from July 1 to 6, according to Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) figures. Notably, the city reported 1,053 new COVID-19 cases on Wednesday, while 985 people recovered from the disease in one day. The number of active cases in Bengaluru now stands at 6,056.

327.title: Rajesh Nambiar to no longer serve as Cognizant's digital business head
327.article_body: Cognizant has notified its shareholders that Rajesh Nambiar will no longer serve as the Executive Vice President and President of Digital Business and Technology, effective July 6. Nambiar will continue to serve as EVP, Chairman and Managing Director of Cognizant India. Cognizant has said that it will be simplifying its internal operating structure around practice areas and delivery operations.

328.title: Don't understand why PM Modi is not appealing for peace: Rajasthan CM
328.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said that if PM Narendra Modi would have appealed to the nation the incidents of violence would not have happened. "We are repeatedly appealing to PM Modi to give a message of peace and unity to nation as it will have an impact," he said. "Who is his advisor giving him such advice?" he questioned.

329.title: Indian-origin Rishi Sunak among leaders in race to be next UK PM
329.article_body: Amid reports that Boris Johnson will resign as the Prime Minister of UK, UK's former Finance Minister Rishi Sunak is among the leaders said to be in race to become the next PM. The Indian-origin leader, who is Infosys Co-founder NR Narayana Murthy's son-in-law had resigned citing Johnson's leadership. Liz Truss, Ben Wallace, Jeremy Hunt are among leaders in race.

330.title: He doesn't like us, we don't like him: Russia on UK PM's resignation reports
330.article_body: Russia reacted to reports that UK PM Boris Johnson was set to resign by saying that the news was of 'little concern' to the Kremlin. "He (Johnson) doesn't like us, we don't like him either," said Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov. He said Russia hoped that "more professional people who...make decisions through dialogue will come to power" in the UK.

331.title: The way Nadal competes each time is just brilliant to watch: Tendulkar
331.article_body: Reacting to Rafael Nadal's quarter-final win against Taylor Fritz at Wimbledon 2022, former India cricketer Sachin Tendulkar said it was an amazing game of tennis. "A super competitor who never ever gives up despite all adversities...The way you compete each time you're on the court is just brilliant to watch," tweeted Sachin. Nadal registered a five-set win despite abdominal pain.

332.title: Marriott hotel chain refuses to pay hackers who reportedly stole 20GB data
332.article_body: Marriott hotel chain has confirmed another data breach in which hackers claim to have stolen 20 gigabytes of sensitive data, including customer payment information. Marriott said the chain identified the incident before the hackers contacted the company and it refused to pay them. The firm said a Marriott hotel associate was tricked into providing access to their computer to hackers.

333.title: Had just ₹18 in my bank account, used to live on one Parle-G packet a day: Rajkummar Rao
333.article_body: Recalling the time when he moved to Mumbai, actor Rajkummar Rao said, "There were times when I lived on one Parle-G packet a day with just ₹18 in my bank account." He further said, "Luckily, I had friends from film school who helped. But I never had a Plan B. I always wanted to become an actor."

334.title: 18 Gir lions captured in single frame for the first time by wildlife photographer's wife
334.article_body: Preeti Pandya, wife of wildlife conservationist and wildlife photographer Bhushan Pandya, captured 18 Gir lions in one frame during the couple's visit to the Gir forest in Gujarat on World Environment Day last month. This is the highest number of Gir lions to be captured in a single frame in the history of the forest, reported The Indian Express.

335.title: Stop digging roads during rains or else we'll protest: MNS to PMC
335.article_body: The Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) has demanded that the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) should immediately stop digging city roads during the rainy season, warning that the party will resort to holding protests otherwise. "Despite the arrival of monsoon, PMC has dug up roads in many areas...causing traffic snarls and public inconvenience," MNS leader Babu Wagaskar said.

336.title: What protections will Apple's Lockdown Mode for its devices include?
336.article_body: In Apple's Lockdown Mode, most message attachment types other than images are blocked. Certain complex web technologies, like just-in-time JavaScript compilation, are disabled unless user excludes a trusted site from Lockdown Mode. Incoming invitations and service requests from Apple services, including FaceTime calls, are blocked if user has not previously sent the initiator a call or request.

337.title: Leader like no other: Virat Kohli wishes MS Dhoni on his 41st birthday
337.article_body: Team India batter Virat Kohli took to Twitter to wish former India captain MS Dhoni on his 41st birthday on Thursday. "A leader like no other. Thanks for everything you have done for Indian cricket. You became more like an elder brother for me. Nothing but love and respect always," wrote Kohli. Dhoni celebrated his birthday in London.

338.title: GrowthX secures $1.5 million in seed funding from 212 investors
338.article_body: Bengaluru-based edtech startup GrowthX has raised $1.5 million in a seed funding round, which saw participation from 212 investors. The startup said this was the largest-ever community-led seed round as 65% of the funds were raised from its own community members. Founders and executives from companies like Razorpay, Myntra, CRED, Google, Airbnb and Lenskart invested in the round.

339.title: Maha CM Eknath Shinde's locality water-logged amid heavy rain in Thane
339.article_body: Heavy overnight rain reportedly caused water-logging at various places in Thane, including Chief Minister Eknath Shinde's locality, on Thursday. Local firemen received a call around 6:15 am about flooding near Shinde's residence, following which civic personnel rushed to the spot and cleared the flood waters, an official said. Rains also caused trees to fall in some places, he added.

340.title: Man found dead in drain amid heavy rain in Maharashtra's Palghar
340.article_body: A man was found dead in a swollen drain in Maharashtra's Palghar district amid heavy rainfall. Police said it is suspected that the man, Rahul Vishwakarma, may have slipped into the drain and got washed away. The body was highly decomposed, police said, adding that it was sent to a government hospital for post-mortem.

341.title: Very heavy to extremely heavy rainfall warning in several states; IMD releases list
341.article_body: IMD has predicted isolated extremely heavy rainfall in Goa for five days and in Telangana, Karnataka, Gujarat and Uttarakhand between July 7 and 9. Very heavy rainfall is likely over Maharashtra, Andhra Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, Himachal Pradesh, Punjab, Haryana, Chandigarh and south Rajasthan between July 7 and 11. IMD issued red alert for Mumbai, Thane and Palghar for tomorrow.

342.title: India curbs exports of wheat flour & related products from July 12
342.article_body: India has restricted the export of wheat flour (atta) and other related products like maida, semolina (rava) etc, making it mandatory for all such exporters to seek prior permission for the exports. A Directorate General of Foreign Trade notification said that the restrictions will come into effect from July 12. India had earlier banned wheat exports amid a heatwave.

343.title: Aarey protest not just to protect people but also the city: Cong's Aslam
343.article_body: Speaking on protest against Aarey metro car shed, Congress' Aslam Shaikh said that the protest isn't only to protect people's houses but also the city. "In three days of rains, we've witnessed [Mumbai] submerge...Forest area should be left the way it is," Shaikh added. This comes after the newly-formed Maharashtra government approved decision to relocate car shed to Aarey colony.

344.title: Pune Cantonment Board is in a precarious financial condition: New CEO
344.article_body: Pune Cantonment Board's new CEO Subrat Pal has expressed concerns over financial crunch being faced by the board. "The board is in a precarious financial condition," he said, adding that giving salaries to the staff would also be difficult if the Centre doesn't provide enough funds in next two months. The board's monthly expenditure is estimated to be ₹6 crore.

345.title: Kangana recalls her Koffee with Karan episode, says 'It was a surgical strike'
345.article_body: Kangana Ranaut took a veiled dig at Karan Johar as he gears for the premiere of 'Koffee With Karan 7'. Ahead of the episode's release, Kangana took to Instagram Stories and wrote, "Good luck to papa jo...but what about this episode oh sorry!!! surgical strike, ghar mein ghusss ke mara tha na, my episode is his most popular episode."

346.title: Man takes Mumbai woman to Bihar after kidnapping her; rapes her
346.article_body: Police have arrested a 27-year-old man for allegedly kidnapping and taking a 25-year-old Mumbai-based woman to Bihar and raping her. He kidnapped her in January 2022 when she took a train to visit North India. According to a police officer, a relative of the accused, identified as Vaisaid Nisar, was stalking the woman online and in person since November 2021.

347.title: You've to go down to hell to beat him: Taylor Fritz after loss vs Nadal
347.article_body: Following his defeat against Rafael Nadal in the quarter-finals of Wimbledon 2022, American tennis player Taylor Fritz said, "I still believe...[Nadal] can be beaten. Only, you have to go down to hell to achieve it." "This loss is the one that hurts the most...When the match was over, I felt like crying...[I've] never felt this after a loss," added Fritz.

348.title: IIT Madras develops AI tool that can predict cancer-causing genes
