348.article_body: Researchers at IIT Madras have developed an artificial intelligence tool that is capable of predicting cancer-causing genes in an individual. The tool called 'PIVOT' can help in devising personalised cancer treatments, the institute said. Researchers have currently created AI prediction models for three types of cancer but they are planning to build models for more cancer types.

349.title: Security issues in Pacific should be solved locally: New Zealand PM
349.article_body: New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern on Thursday said that security challenges in the Pacific region need to be resolved locally. She also said that regional architecture such as the Pacific Islands Forum is critical in resolving local problems. Her comments come amid growing concerns in New Zealand, Australia and the US about China's growing influence in the region.

350.title: Will start centre to train underprivileged aspiring actors for free: Sood
350.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood said he'll start a centre where aspiring actors, technicians from underprivileged backgrounds will be trained for free. "[I've] seen people who come to Mumbai and cannot survive...[I want to give them] access...that a newcomer cannot get...When I came to Mumbai, I didn't have anybody to guide me...There are sharks who take advantage of the innocent," added Sood.

351.title: Had ₹1500 in my account, was like 'Can't afford to do sh*t': Anurag's daughter
351.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap's daughter Aaliyah Kashyap recalled having ₹1500 in her account after moving out. "I was like literally, 'Can't afford to do sh*t'...I literally had to tell my mom to send me food at home because I couldn't afford to even get groceries for three days. It was not a fun time, would never do that again," she added.

352.title: Alia & I've been talking about having kids from the first day we met: Ranbir
352.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor opened up about having a baby with his wife, actress Alia Bhatt. Ranbir said that he and Alia have been talking about having kids from the first day they met and fell in love and revealed that they've always wanted children. "To start a new chapter in life...I am extremely excited about that...can't wait," he added.

353.title: 3 more PFI activists arrested in Nizamabad, booked under UAPA
353.article_body: The Nizamabad Police in Telangana arrested three PFI activists on charges of allegedly attempting to create religious animosity and training youngsters in usage of lethal weapons. They were booked under UAPA and other sections of IPC. This comes after a PFI activist was arrested for training youth in martial arts in Nizamabad.

354.title: Cong blames BJP after B'luru ranked 'least liveable' city in India
354.article_body: Congress MLA Ramalinga Reddy has blamed the BJP government in Karnataka after Bengaluru was ranked the 'least liveable' city in India. He said, "[Bengaluru] has lost the ranking due to the poor quality of infrastructure, roads...For all this...BJP...[is] the reason." Bengaluru has been ranked 146 (score 54.4), the least among five Indian cities which featured on Global Liveability Index 2022.

355.title: Fake number of BBMP chief circulates online; complaint filed
355.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner Tushar Giri Nath said that a fake number has been circulating in his name online. "Please note that 7076522681 isn't my number," Nath said, adding that some fraudster is using this number to mislead the public and officials. He also said that he has filed a complaint with Karnataka CID in this regard.

356.title: Taliban digs out Toyota car used by its former leader to escape US invasion
356.article_body: Taliban militants in Afghanistan dug out a Toyota car used by their former leader Mullah Omar to escape being targeted by US forces after the 9/11 attacks in 2001. The white Toyota Corolla was buried in a village garden in Zabul province. "It is still in good condition, only its front is a bit damaged," Taliban militant Rahmatullah Hammad said.

357.title: Biden speaks with wife of US basketball player detained in Russia
357.article_body: US President Joe Biden spoke with the wife of basketball player Brittney Griner, who's being detained in Russia on drug charges, the White House said. Biden assured Cherelle Griner that he's working to secure Brittney's release "as soon as possible". This comes after Brittney, in a handwritten letter to Biden, said that she fears she'll be detained in Russia indefinitely.

358.title: Was like being in the middle of a war zone: Moeen on 2022 CL final chaos
358.article_body: Sharing his experience at France's Stade de France before the 2022 Champions League final between Liverpool and Real Madrid, English cricketer Moeen Ali said, "It was...like being in the middle of a war zone." "We had...kids...and they were crying, it was horrible...I didn't feel safe...Pepper spray, crushing, police with shields, fights...I just wanted to get home," added Moeen.

359.title: PMPML to install boom barriers at 148 junctions on BRTS routes
359.article_body: The Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Ltd (PMPML) has decided to install 148 automatic boom barriers on Bus Rapid Transit System (BRTS) routes in the city. "PMPML hopes to bring a check on private vehicles entering dedicated BRTS lanes by installing automatic boom barriers...They will be operated on a number plate recognition-based access control and monitoring system," an official said.

360.title: JNU not a place to pursue political aspirations: VC
360.article_body: Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) Vice Chancellor Santishree Dhulipudi Pandit on Wednesday said that JNU is not a place for pursuing political aspirations. "Language is a sensitive issue, pushing a particular language too hard could lead to regionalism," she added. She claimed that 90% of JNU students are apolitical and only 10% are "troublemakers".

361.title: FIR against ex-Kerala minister Saji Cherian over anti-Constitution remarks
361.article_body: An FIR was lodged on Thursday at Keezhvaipur Police Station against former Kerala Culture Minister Saji Cherian over anti-Constitution remarks. Cherian on Wednesday resigned from the state Cabinet amid protests over his remarks. The Constitution endorses exploitation and loot of common people, he had said. "The news that I criticised the Constitution is twisted," Cherian later said.

362.title: Mohammed Zubair approaches Supreme Court against UP Police FIR
362.article_body: Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair has moved the Supreme Court for quashing of a hate speech FIR registered against him in Uttar Pradesh's Sitapur. He has also moved the court for pre-arrest bail. Zubair's lawyer Colin Gonsalves has approached the apex court against the Allahabad High Court's decision to not quash the FIR against him on June 13.

363.title: 5 pet puppies of 69-yr-old woman killed by poisoning in Mumbai
363.article_body: Five pet puppies belonging to a 69-year-old woman were allegedly killed by poisoning in Mumbai's Kandivali. The woman said that her puppies suddenly fell ill and died with foam and blood coming out of their mouths. She suspects that her 35-year-old neighbour, who frequently used to pick fights with her over the pets, might have killed the dogs.

364.title: Twitter should check tweets by perverted mentality people: MP minister
364.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra has said he will write to Twitter on tweets hurting religious sentiments, adding, "Twitter should check tweets posted by people having perverted mentality, like...'Kaali' film director, Leena Manimekalai." He will also write to the central government to issue a lookout circular against Manimekalai "as whatever she is doing appears to be deliberate".

365.title: Kohli not a certainty in India's T20I side: Wasim Jaffer
365.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said Virat Kohli's form will be "taken into consideration" in the upcoming T20Is against England. "Kohli has not been in the best of forms...I don't think he'll be a certainty because so many young players have done so well," stated Jaffer. Kohli will be available for the second and third T20I against England.

366.title: My political tenure not yet completed: Naqvi after resigning as Union Minister
366.article_body: A day after resigning as the Union Cabinet Minister of Minority Affairs, Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi on Thursday said that his political and social tenure has not yet been completed. “I understand that my tenure in Rajya Sabha has been completed...I will continue to work with dedication and concern for society,” he added.

367.title: Siddaramaiah's govt was unresponsive to many scams: K'taka CM Bommai
367.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Wednesday said the government led by Congress leader Siddaramaiah was unresponsive to many scams related to recruitment tests and PU (pre-university) exams. "It was a government that covered up many such scams," Bommai added. The scam related to PU exams, involving ₹18 crore, was buried without taking any action against the culprits, Bommai alleged.

368.title: BJP sending army of trolls to spread false info about SC judges: Cong
368.article_body: The Congress accused BJP of promoting personal attacks on Supreme Court judges and making campaigns to pressurise and influence free decision-making of the judiciary. "An army of trolls is sent out by BJP to fabricate and disseminate false information about the judges and altered photos are published to suggest a false closeness with Congress leaders," party spokesperson Abhishek Singhvi said.

369.title: Gita Gopinath becomes the only woman to feature on the wall of former IMF Chief Economists
369.article_body: Gita Gopinath, the First Deputy Managing Director at the IMF, has become the first woman whose portrait was featured on the wall of former Chief Economists of the IMF. "Breaking the trend...I joined the wall of former Chief Economists of the IMF," tweeted Gopinath sharing two photos. She served as the Chief Economist of the Fund from 2019 to 2022.

370.title: ALLEN sues 20 ex-educators for alleged breach of contract: Report
370.article_body: ALLEN Career Institute has sued 20 of its former educators for alleged breach of employee agreements, media reports said. The platform alleged that the teachers breached the service agreement by not serving a four-month notice period and not completing their service tenure. However, a Jaipur court dismissed plea against five educators who argued the clauses were against basic employees' rights.

371.title: Mentally unstable man beats 62-yr-old priest to death in Delhi
371.article_body: A mentally unstable man allegedly thrashed a 62-year-old priest to death in Delhi's Sonia Vihar, police said on Thursday. The accused, identified as Sonu Bhatt, was reportedly assaulted by locals following the incident and is currently in a hospital. After preliminary investigation, police found that Bhatt is not in a "healthy state of mind" and was known to the deceased.

372.title: Go now: New UK Finance Minister as he asks PM Johnson to resign
372.article_body: Britain's new Finance Minister Nadhim Zahawi has told Boris Johnson to resign, less than 48 hours after the PM promoted him to the job. "He is now undermining the incredible achievements of this government. The country deserves a government that is not only stable, but which acts with integrity," Zahawi said. Over 50 MPs have resigned form Johnson's government.

373.title: Actor Sreejith Ravi arrested for allegedly flashing his genitals at 2 minor girls
373.article_body: Actor Sreejith Ravi, who appears in Malayalam and Tamil films, has been arrested for allegedly flashing his genitals at two minor girls at a park in Ayyanthole in Kerala's Thrissur. The Thrissur West Police has registered a case under POCSO Act against him. Following the complaint by the girls, CCTV footage examined by the police confirmed the man was Sreejith.

374.title: Biden to revoke Afghanistan’s designation as major non-NATO ally
374.article_body: US President Joe Biden in a letter to Congress on Wednesday said that he intends to rescind the designation of Afghanistan as a major non-NATO ally. Afghanistan was given the status in 2012. The move comes after the Taliban took control of Afghanistan last year after the US withdrew its troops from the country following 20 years of war.

375.title: 'Kaali' director posts pic of people dressed as God, Goddess smoking amid poster issue
375.article_body: Amid controversy over the poster of her movie 'Kaali', director Leena Manimekalai posted a picture showing people dressed as God and Goddess smoking. Meanwhile, microblogging site Twitter has removed the July 2 tweet of the filmmaker which depicted an actress dressed as Goddess Kaali smoking.

376.title: Won't stop work on Eastern Rajasthan Canal Project: CM Ashok Gehlot
376.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Wednesday said his government won't stop work on the Eastern Rajasthan Canal Project (ERCP). His comments came after Jal Shakti Ministry asked Rajasthan government to hold the project citing "lack of consent on interstate issues". "Water is [of] the state...the catchment area is ours...who're you to tell us to stop the project?" Gehlot further said.

377.title: Why not call 3rd one to shoot too: Big B on Ajay, Rohit's 'Bol Bachchan' pic
377.article_body: As 'Bol Bachchan' completed ten years, actor Ajay Devgn shared a picture of himself with filmmaker Rohit Shetty. Actor Amitabh Bachchan, who was seen in the film's title song, commented on the post saying, "Oh man, why won't you call the third one to shoot as well." The film also featured actor Abhishek Bachchan and actresses Asin and Prachi Desai.

378.title: EAM Jaishankar holds 1-hour meet with China's Foreign Minister on border issues in Bali
378.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar met China's Foreign Minister Wang Yi in Bali on the sidelines of G-20 Foreign Ministers' Meeting. Jaishankar tweeted, "Discussion lasted one hour. Focused on specific outstanding issues in our bilateral relationship pertaining to the border situation." The EAM added that they also discussed other matters including students and flights.

379.title: More than 50 Members of Parliament quit UK PM's government in less than 48 hours
379.article_body: More than 50 Members of Parliament have quit UK PM Boris Johnson's government in less than 48 hours. Johnson sacked Michael Gove from his cabinet post on Wednesday night after the leader told the PM to resign. Among those who have stepped down are Sajid Javid who was serving as Health Secretary and Finance Minister Rishi Sunak.

380.title: Fintech firms, NBFCs funded by Chinese money generated ₹950-cr slush funds in India: ED
380.article_body: Several fintech companies and non-banking financial companies (NBFCs) backed by Chinese funds generated proceeds of crime worth nearly ₹950 crore by indulging in predatory lending activities and violating RBI guidelines in India, the ED said. The ED has mounted a crackdown on such companies who, it said, were "operating on the basis of instructions from Chinese, Hong Kong persons".

381.title: Pant has improved remarkably as a keeper like MS Dhoni did: Manjrekar
381.article_body: Ex-India batter Sanjay Manjrekar said he was earlier sceptical about Rishabh Pant's ability as a keeper in English conditions, but termed his keeping during the Tests against England as "strikingly brilliant". "Pant has taken the job very seriously and his improvement has...been remarkable, just like [Dhoni's was]...The big news for India is the growth of Pant, the wicketkeeper," added Manjrekar.

382.title: Govt launches indigenously made motor & controller tech for e-rickshaws
382.article_body: The government has launched an indigenous, efficient, affordable and certified BLDC motor and smart controller technology for e-rickshaws developed by IIT Kharagpur. The technology was developed under the electronics and IT ministry's programme for the indigenous development of electric vehicle subsystems. It was transferred to Brushless Motor India for commercial production.

383.title: Bagga sends flowers to CM Mann on getting married, shares screenshot
383.article_body: BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga sent flower bouquet to Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on his wedding. He posted the screenshot of his order worth ₹568 on his Twitter handle and wrote, "Sent flowers and Best wishes message to Bhagwant Mann ji on his wedding." Bagga had earlier criticised CM Mann for spending on advertisements of Punjab government's paperless budget.

384.title: Real consumers of Skin Foods Glow Mix feature with Malaika Arora: Kapiva
384.article_body: Kapiva's Glow Mix consumers Aishwarya & Krishna featured alongside Malaika on ELLE, showcasing their confidence from healthy glowing skin and emphasizing that skin needs inner nutrition beyond creams & serums. Malaika's secret for healthy skin is 10+ Ayurvedic herbs in Glow Mix that boost collagen production, naturally leading to healthy, glowing, clearer skin that boosts confidence, said Kapiva.

385.title: When you have big squad, it's difficult to determine the XI: Zaheer
385.article_body: Ahead of India's first T20I against England, ex-India pacer Zaheer Khan has said India should begin selecting players for the T20 World Cup in Australia later this year. "When you have such a big squad, it becomes difficult to determine which players should play," stated Zaheer. "The team [management] have to see what sort of combination they finalise," he added.

386.title: WHO calls emergency meeting as global monkeypox cases cross 6,000
386.article_body: The World Health Organization said that over 6,000 cases of monkeypox have now been reported from 58 countries, with over 80% of the cases in Europe. The agency will reconvene a meeting of the emergency committee "in the week of July 18 or sooner" to reassess whether the outbreak constitutes a public health emergency, WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said.

387.title: 66 Shiv Sena corporators from Thane join Maha CM Shinde's camp
387.article_body: As many as 66 Shiv Sena corporators from Thane, led by former mayor Naresh Muske, visited Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde's official residence at Nandanvan and joined his camp. Former Amravati Lok Sabha MP, Anandrao Vithoba Adsul, also resigned as a Sena leader. Shiv Sena is currently divided into two camps, one led by Uddhav Thackeray and the other by Shinde.

388.title: They told me I needed to retire vs Fritz, don't know if I'll play semis: Nadal
388.article_body: Rafael Nadal has revealed that his team asked him to retire during his quarter-final win against Taylor Fritz due to his abdominal injury. "It's something that I hate to do. So, I just kept trying," he added. However, on being asked about his chances of playing the semi-final against Nick Kyrgios, Nadal said, "I can't give you a clear answer."

389.title: Murmu as President a matter of pride for country: Maha CM Eknath Shinde
389.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde said tribal community member Droupadi Murmu's nomination for the Presidential election is a matter of pride for our country. "PM Modi has given an opportunity to Murmu to become the...President. It's a matter of pride and honour," he said. "I am also proud that a tribal community member has been nominated for the post," he added.

390.title: I worry for India, they don't have bowling options: Vaughan on T20 WC
390.article_body: Talking about the upcoming T20 World Cup 2022, ex-England captain Michael Vaughan said he is "worried" about India not having enough bowling options. "It is about trying to find players in the top five, who can offer you overs. Maybe Hardik Pandya bats in the top five," added Vaughan. "They have got to find a better mechanism," he stated.

391.title: Sky turns green in several US' cities after powerful storm, pics go viral
391.article_body: Sky over several cities in US' states of South Dakota, Nebraska and Iowa turned green following a powerful storm. The US' National Weather Service (NWS) said the storm was a derecho. It brought powerful winds, with speeds of around 159 kmph in some areas. "Have never seen something like that," a Twitter user wrote sharing a picture of green sky.

392.title: Twitter removes director Leena's Kaali poster tweet showing goddess smoking; she responds
392.article_body: Twitter has removed filmmaker Leena Manimekalai's 'Kaali' movie poster tweet which showed the goddess smoking. Manimekalai tweeted, "This is hilarious. Will Twitter India withhold the tweets of the 200000 hate mongers?! These lowlife trolls tweeted and spread the very same poster that they find objectionable." She added Kaali is the goddess of death and cannot be lynched, raped or destroyed.

393.title: Woman, 3 lawyers extort money after lodging fake rape case in Agra, arrested
393.article_body: Agra Police in UP arrested a woman and three lawyers allegedly involved in extorting money by lodging a fake rape case against a man. The woman alleged that she was raped by the man at a hotel. "The woman complainant and three lawyers were arrested along with cash of ₹3.75 lakh," an official said.

394.title: Over 90 ill due to diarrhoea outbreak in Lucknow
394.article_body: More than 90 people have fallen ill after a diarrhoea outbreak in Lucknow's Aliganj allegedly due to contaminated water supply in the area. While eight people have been admitted to hospital due to nausea and loose motions, a one-year-old child reportedly died due to the disease. "We took samples of...water...prima facie it appears to be contaminated," a medical officer said.

395.title: Level 2 fire breaks out in Mumbai supermarket, 12 fire tenders rushed
395.article_body: A level two fire broke out in Haiko Supermarket in Hiranandani Powai area of Mumbai. News agency ANI reported that 12 fire tenders were rushed to the spot. Reports also said that no one has been reported trapped in the building so far. No injuries or casualties have been reported.

396.title: Policeman removed from post over objectionable comments against UP CM
396.article_body: A station house officer (SHO) of Asandra Police Station in Uttar Pradesh's Barabanki has been removed from his post for allegedly making objectionable comments against CM Yogi Adityanath. BJP district president Shashank Kushumesh received a video from a journalist wherein the SHO was purportedly making comments against CM Yogi while talking to someone in his office room.

397.title: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann gets married to Dr Gurpreet Kaur, first pic surfaces
397.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Thursday got married to Dr Gurpreet Kaur in a private ceremony, which was also attended by Delhi CM and AAP Convenor Arvind Kejriwal. Mann was earlier married to Inderpreet Kaur, with whom he got divorced in 2015. He has two children from his first marriage.

398.title: Islamic State claims responsibility for prison attack in Nigeria
398.article_body: Islamic State militant group has claimed responsibility for attacking a prison in Nigeria's capital Abuja on Tuesday. A total of 879 inmates had fled following the attack. Around 443 are still at large and the rest have been recaptured, the prison service said. Nigeria's President Muhammadu Buhari has questioned the prison's intelligence system and demanded a report on the attack.

399.title: CAs who helped Chinese nationals establish Vivo-linked firm under probe: Report
399.article_body: Indian agencies are now probing the local support that two Chinese nationals got in establishing a company which projected itself as a subsidiary of Vivo, The Economic Times reported citing sources. Two chartered accountants and a company secretary are under probe in the matter. Forged documents, certified by the three, were allegedly used to register Grand Prospect International Communication.

400.title: 12-year-old girl sexually harassed in Gurugram, accused arrested
400.article_body: A 24-year-old man was arrested in Gurugram for allegedly sexually harassing a 12-year-old girl. "Earlier, I took the matter to the panchayat where Sanjay (accused) was asked [not to do] such a thing again," the victim's father said. However, the accused harassed the girl again on Tuesday, her father claimed, following which he filed a complaint with the police.

401.title: Other Muslims are Assamese too: Assam CM on indigenous status to 5 Muslim communities
401.article_body: After Assam cabinet granted indigenous status to five Assamese-speaking Muslim communities, Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said other Muslims are Assamese too and shouldn't worry. "They are Goria, Moriya, Deshi, Julah and Syed," state Health Minister Keshab Mahanta said earlier. This will ensure their development in health, education, skill development and women empowerment, Sarma said.

402.title: Over 44,000 challans issued under bus lane enforcement drive in Delhi
402.article_body: Delhi government's transport department has challaned a total of 44,594 people over the last two months under its bus lane enforcement drive. According to the department, till July 4, 1,591 bus drivers were challaned for lane violations, whereas 43,003 challans were issued to private vehicle owners for parking in bus lanes. The drive was launched on April 1 this year.
